headline: Pfizer CEO: no commitments made in drug price meetings with US government
summary: (Reuters) -Pfizer and other drug companies have met with the Trump administration to discuss lowering U.S. drug prices but no commitments have been made, Chief Executive Albert Bourla said on Monday.  President Donald Trump last month issued an executive order directing drugmakers to lower the prices of their medicines to align with what other countries pay.  According to the order, the administration was to set "Most Favored Nation" price targets within 30 days.
